#!/usr/bin/env python
# coding: utf-8

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.window import Window
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import logging
from datetime import datetime
import time

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
logger = logging.getLogger()

# Initialize Spark session with Delta Lake support
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("Voters Data Lake Export - PostgreSQL Schema") \
    .config("spark.sql.extensions", "io.delta.sql.DeltaSparkSessionExtension") \
    .config("spark.sql.catalog.spark_catalog", "org.apache.spark.sql.delta.catalog.DeltaCatalog") \
    .getOrCreate()

def clean_data_before_transformation(df):
    """
    Comprehensive data cleaning before PostgreSQL transformation
    """
    logger.info("Starting comprehensive data cleaning")
    
    initial_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Initial record count: {initial_count}")
    
    # Step 0: Clean register_lett and poll_number fields (critical for data quality)
    logger.info("Step 0: Cleaning register_lett and poll_number fields")
    
    # Clean register_lett: strip whitespace and truncate to 5 chars
    if "register_lett" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("register_lett",
            when(col("register_lett").isNull(), lit(None))
            .otherwise(substring(trim(col("register_lett").cast("string")), 1, 5))
        )
        logger.info("‚úÖ Cleaned register_lett: stripped and truncated to 5 characters")
    
    # Clean poll_number: remove .0 from floats, ensure numeric, truncate to 5 chars
    if "poll_number" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("poll_number_temp",
            # First convert to string and remove .0 suffix if present
            regexp_replace(col("poll_number").cast("string"), "\\.0$", "")
        ).withColumn("poll_number_numeric",
            # Convert to numeric, coercing errors to null
            col("poll_number_temp").cast("double")
        ).withColumn("poll_number",
            # Convert back to string and truncate to 5 chars
            when(col("poll_number_numeric").isNull(), lit(None))
            .otherwise(substring(col("poll_number_numeric").cast("int").cast("string"), 1, 5))
        ).drop("poll_number_temp", "poll_number_numeric")
        logger.info("‚úÖ Cleaned poll_number: removed .0 suffix, ensured numeric, truncated to 5 characters")
    
    # Step 0.5: Fix DOB format from DD/MM/YYYY to YYYY-MM-DD
    logger.info("Step 0.5: Converting DOB from DD/MM/YYYY to YYYY-MM-DD format")
    if "dob" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("dob",
            when(col("dob").isNull(), lit(None))
            .when(trim(col("dob")) == "", lit(None))
            .when(upper(trim(col("dob"))).isin(["NULL", "NAN", "NA"]), lit(None))
            .otherwise(
                # Try DD/MM/YYYY format first (most common in your data)
                coalesce(
                    to_date(col("dob"), "dd/MM/yyyy"),
                    to_date(col("dob"), "yyyy-MM-dd"),
                    to_date(col("dob"), "MM/dd/yyyy"),
                    to_date(col("dob"), "yyyy/MM/dd"),
                    to_date(col("dob"), "dd-MM-yyyy"),
                    to_date(col("dob"), "MM-dd-yyyy")
                )
            )
        )
        logger.info("‚úÖ Converted DOB to proper date format (will be YYYY-MM-DD in output)")
    
    # Step 1: Remove records with NULL/empty lname or fname
    logger.info("Step 1: Removing records with NULL/empty lname or fname")
    df = df.filter(
        (col("lname").isNotNull()) & 
        (trim(col("lname")) != "") & 
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NULL") &
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NA") &
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NAN") &
        (col("fname").isNotNull()) & 
        (trim(col("fname")) != "") & 
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NULL") &
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NA") &
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NAN")
    )
    
    after_name_filter = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after name filtering: {after_name_filter}")
    
    # Step 2: Ensure address is not null and not empty
    logger.info("Step 2: Ensuring address is not null/empty")
    df = df.filter(
        (col("address").isNotNull()) & 
        (trim(col("address")) != "") &
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) != "NULL") &
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) != "NA") &
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) != "NAN")
    )
    
    after_address_filter = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after address filtering: {after_address_filter}")
    
    # Step 3: Clean address4 - remove if it matches zip without spaces
    logger.info("Step 3: Cleaning address4 - removing zip code duplicates")
    df = df.withColumn("address4", 
        when(col("address4") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""), lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address4"))
    )
    
    # Step 4: Remove "NAN" values from address4
    logger.info("Step 4: Removing 'NAN' values from address4")
    df = df.withColumn("address4", 
        when(upper(trim(col("address4"))) == "NAN", lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address4"))
    )
    
    # Step 5: Address4 cannot be empty - comprehensive address shifting
    logger.info("Step 5: Ensuring address4 is not empty through comprehensive shifting")
    
    # Shift address3 to address4 if address4 is null and address3 is not null
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address3").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address3")) != ""),
            col("address3")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    ).withColumn("address3",
        when(
            (col("address4") == col("address3")) & 
            (col("address4").isNotNull()),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(col("address3"))
    )
    
    # Shift address2 to address4 if address4 is still null and address2 doesn't start with number
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address2").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address2")) != "") &
            (regexp_extract(trim(col("address2")), "^([0-9])", 1) == ""),  # doesn't start with number
            col("address2")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    ).withColumn("address2",
        when(
            (col("address4") == col("address2")) & 
            (col("address4").isNotNull()),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(col("address2"))
    )
    
    # If address4 is still null, try address5 or address6
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address5").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address5")) != ""),
            col("address5")
        ).when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address6").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address6")) != ""),
            col("address6")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    )
    
    # Final cleanup - remove records that still have null address4
    logger.info("Step 6: Final cleanup - removing records with null address4")
    before_final_filter = df.count()
    after_final_filter = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after final address4 filtering: {after_final_filter} (removed: {before_final_filter - after_final_filter})")
    
    # Clean other NAN/NULL values
    logger.info("Step 7: Cleaning other NAN/NULL values")
    
    # Clean address fields
    for addr_col in ["address", "address2", "address3", "address4", "address5", "address6"]:
        df = df.withColumn(addr_col,
            when(upper(trim(col(addr_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
            .otherwise(col(addr_col))
        )
    
    # Clean other string fields
    for str_col in ["title", "new_marker", "flags", "perm_disqual", "source_id"]:
        if str_col in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(str_col,
                when(upper(trim(col(str_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
                .otherwise(col(str_col))
            )
    
    final_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Final record count after comprehensive cleaning: {final_count}")
    logger.info(f"Total records removed: {initial_count - final_count}")
    
    
    # Clean address fields
    for addr_col in ["address", "address2", "address3", "address4", "address5", "address6"]:
        df = df.withColumn(addr_col,
            when(upper(trim(col(addr_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
            .otherwise(col(addr_col))
        )
    
    # Clean other string fields
    for str_col in ["title", "new_marker", "flags", "perm_disqual", "source_id"]:
        if str_col in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(str_col,
                when(upper(trim(col(str_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
                .otherwise(col(str_col))
            )
    
    final_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Final record count after comprehensive cleaning: {final_count}")
    logger.info(f"Total records removed: {initial_count - final_count}")
    
    return df

def transform_to_postgresql_schema(df):
    """
    Transform DataFrame to match exact PostgreSQL juror_mod.voters schema
    Note: part_no will be NULL here as it's generated by PostgreSQL sequence
    """
    logger.info("Starting transformation to PostgreSQL schema")
    
    # Apply comprehensive data cleaning first
    df = clean_data_before_transformation(df)
    
    # Apply field length constraints and transformations
    logger.info("Applying field length constraints")
    
    df_constrained = df \
        .withColumn("part_no", lit(None).cast(StringType())) \
        .withColumn("register_lett", 
                   when(col("register_lett").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("register_lett")), 1, 5))) \
        .withColumn("poll_number", 
                   when(col("poll_number").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("poll_number")), 1, 5))) \
        .withColumn("new_marker", 
                   when(col("new_marker").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("new_marker")), 1, 1))) \
        .withColumn("title", 
                   when(col("title").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("title")), 1, 10))) \
        .withColumn("lname", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("lname"))), 1, 20)) \
        .withColumn("fname", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("fname"))), 1, 20)) \
        .withColumn("flags", 
                   when(col("flags").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("flags")), 1, 2))) \
        .withColumn("address", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("address"))), 1, 35)) \
        .withColumn("address2", 
                   when(col("address2").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address2"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address3",
                   when(col("address3").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address3"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address4",
                   when(col("address4").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address4"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address5",
                   when(col("address5").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address5"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address6", 
                   when(col("address6").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .when(trim(col("address6")) == "", lit(None))
                   .otherwise(lit(None))) \
        .withColumn("zip", 
                   when(col("zip").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("zip"))), 1, 10))) \
        .withColumn("perm_disqual", 
                   when(col("perm_disqual").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .when(trim(col("perm_disqual")) == "", lit(None))
                   .otherwise(lit(None))) \
        .withColumn("source_id", 
                   when(col("source_id").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .when(trim(col("source_id")) == "", lit(None))
                   .otherwise(lit(None)))
    
    logger.info("Field constraints applied successfully")
    
    # Handle date fields - convert string dates to proper date type or NULL for PostgreSQL
    logger.info("Converting date fields - ensuring empty strings become NULL")
    
    # Function to properly handle date conversion for PostgreSQL (YYYY-MM-DD format)
    def safe_date_conversion(date_col):
        return when(
            (col(date_col).isNull()) | 
            (trim(col(date_col)) == "") |
            (upper(trim(col(date_col))).isin(["NULL", "NAN", "NA"])),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(
            # Try multiple input formats but always convert to YYYY-MM-DD
            coalesce(
                to_date(col(date_col), "yyyy-MM-dd"),    # Already in correct format
                to_date(col(date_col), "dd/MM/yyyy"),    # Convert from DD/MM/YYYY
                to_date(col(date_col), "MM/dd/yyyy"),    # Convert from MM/DD/YYYY
                to_date(col(date_col), "yyyy/MM/dd"),    # Convert from YYYY/MM/DD
                to_date(col(date_col), "dd-MM-yyyy"),    # Convert from DD-MM-YYYY
                to_date(col(date_col), "MM-dd-yyyy")     # Convert from MM-DD-YYYY
            )
        )
    
    df_with_dates = df_constrained \
        .withColumn("dob", safe_date_conversion("dob")) \
        .withColumn("date_selected1", safe_date_conversion("date_selected1")) \
        .withColumn("date_selected2", safe_date_conversion("date_selected2")) \
        .withColumn("date_selected3", safe_date_conversion("date_selected3"))
    
    # Set postcode_start to NULL (generated by PostgreSQL)
    logger.info("Setting postcode_start to NULL - will be generated by PostgreSQL")
    
    df_with_postcode = df_with_dates \
        .withColumn("postcode_start", lit(None).cast(StringType()))
    
    # Ensure rec_num is integer type
    df_with_rec_num = df_with_postcode \
        .withColumn("rec_num", 
                   when(col("rec_num").isNull(), lit(None).cast(IntegerType()))
                   .otherwise(col("rec_num").cast(IntegerType())))
    
    # Ensure creation_date is properly formatted
    df_with_creation_date = df_with_rec_num \
        .withColumn("creation_date", 
                   when(col("creation_date").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(col("creation_date").cast(StringType())))
    
    # Select only the required columns in the correct order
    final_columns = [
        "part_no", "register_lett", "poll_number", "new_marker", "title",
        "lname", "fname", "dob", "flags", "address", "address2", "address3",
        "address4", "address5", "address6", "zip", "date_selected1",
        "date_selected2", "date_selected3", "rec_num", "perm_disqual",
        "source_id", "postcode_start", "creation_date", "hash_id"
    ]
    
    df_final = df_with_creation_date.select(*final_columns)
    
    # Final validation - check for any remaining NULL violations
    logger.info("Performing final validation")
    
    null_lname = df_final.filter(col("lname").isNull()).count()
    null_fname = df_final.filter(col("fname").isNull()).count()
    null_address = df_final.filter(col("address").isNull()).count()
    
    if null_lname > 0 or null_fname > 0 or null_address > 0:
        logger.warning(f"NULL constraint violations found: lname={null_lname}, fname={null_fname}, address={null_address}")
        
        # Remove records with NULL violations
        df_final = df_final.filter(
            col("lname").isNotNull() &
            col("fname").isNotNull() &
            col("address").isNotNull()
        )
    
    # Check hash_id uniqueness for deduplication verification
    unique_hash_ids = df_final.select("hash_id").distinct().count()
    total_records = df_final.count()
    
    if unique_hash_ids != total_records:
        logger.warning(f"Duplicate hash_ids found: {total_records - unique_hash_ids} duplicates")
        # Remove duplicates keeping the first occurrence
        window_spec = Window.partitionBy("hash_id").orderBy(col("hash_id"))
        df_final = df_final.withColumn("row_num", row_number().over(window_spec)) \
                          .filter(col("row_num") == 1) \
                          .drop("row_num")
    
    logger.info(f"Final record count after PostgreSQL schema transformation: {df_final.count()}")
    
    return df_final

def create_postgresql_compatible_csv(df, output_path):
    """
    Create a PostgreSQL-compatible CSV export with proper NULL handling
    All dates will be in YYYY-MM-DD format as required by PostgreSQL
    """
    logger.info("Creating PostgreSQL-compatible CSV export with YYYY-MM-DD date format")
    
    # Convert all date columns to YYYY-MM-DD string format, ensuring NULLs are properly handled
    csv_ready_df = df \
        .withColumn("dob", 
                   when(col("dob").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(date_format(col("dob"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected1", 
                   when(col("date_selected1").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(date_format(col("date_selected1"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected2", 
                   when(col("date_selected2").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(date_format(col("date_selected2"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected3", 
                   when(col("date_selected3").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(date_format(col("date_selected3"), "yyyy-MM-dd")))
    
    # Ensure all string fields have proper NULL handling
    string_columns = ["part_no", "register_lett", "poll_number", "new_marker", "title",
                     "lname", "fname", "flags", "address", "address2", "address3",
                     "address4", "address5", "address6", "zip", "perm_disqual",
                     "source_id", "postcode_start", "creation_date", "hash_id"]
    
    for col_name in string_columns:
        if col_name in csv_ready_df.columns:
            csv_ready_df = csv_ready_df.withColumn(col_name,
                when(col(col_name).isNull(), lit(None))
                .when(trim(col(col_name)) == "", lit(None))
                .otherwise(col(col_name))
            )
    
    # Log a sample of date formatting for verification
    logger.info("Sample date formatting verification:")
    sample_dates = csv_ready_df.select("dob", "date_selected1").limit(5).collect()
    for i, row in enumerate(sample_dates):
        logger.info(f"  Row {i+1}: dob={row.dob}, date_selected1={row.date_selected1}")
    
    # Write CSV with PostgreSQL-compatible options
    csv_ready_df.coalesce(1).write \
        .option("header", "true") \
        .option("nullValue", "") \
        .option("emptyValue", "") \
        .option("quote", '"') \
        .option("escape", '"') \
        .option("quoteAll", "false") \
        .mode("overwrite") \
        .csv(output_path)
    
    logger.info("‚úÖ All dates exported in YYYY-MM-DD format for PostgreSQL compatibility")
    return output_path

def export_voters_to_postgresql_schema():
    """
    Main function to export voters data with PostgreSQL schema compliance
    """
    try:
        # Initialize storage paths
        storage_account = "baubaisadfsaprod"
        source_path = f"abfss://dl-juror-eric-voters-temp@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated_delta"
        output_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_postgresql"
        
        # Read the existing Delta table
        logger.info(f"Reading voter data from {source_path}")
        source_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(source_path)
        
        initial_count = source_df.count()
        logger.info(f"Initial Delta table record count: {initial_count}")
        
        # Check if source has data
        if initial_count == 0:
            logger.error("‚ùå No data found in source Delta table")
            return None, None
        
        # Filter for specific batch date (hardcoded for batch processing)
        target_dates = ["20241213", "20241216"]  # Update this for your batch date
        logger.info(f"Filtering for creation_date = {target_dates}")
        
        # Check what creation_dates are available first
        logger.info("Checking available creation_dates...")
        available_dates = source_df.select("creation_date").distinct().orderBy("creation_date").collect()
        logger.info("Available creation_dates:")
        for date_row in available_dates[:10]:  # Show first 10
            count_for_date = source_df.filter(col("creation_date") == lit(date_row.creation_date)).count()
            logger.info(f"   - {date_row.creation_date}: {count_for_date} records")
        
        # Apply the filter
        filtered_df = source_df.filter(col("creation_date").isin(target_dates))
        filtered_count = filtered_df.count()
        
        logger.info(f"Records with creation_date = {target_dates}: {filtered_count}")
        
        if filtered_count == 0:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå No records found for creation_date = {target_dates}")
            logger.error("Please check the available creation_dates above and update the target_dates")
            return None, None
        
        # Apply PostgreSQL schema transformation
        logger.info("Applying PostgreSQL schema transformation")
        postgresql_df = transform_to_postgresql_schema(filtered_df)
        
        if postgresql_df is None:
            logger.error("‚ùå PostgreSQL schema transformation failed")
            return None, None
        
        final_count = postgresql_df.count()
        logger.info(f"Final PostgreSQL schema record count: {final_count}")
        logger.info(f"Records removed during transformation: {filtered_count - final_count}")
        
        if final_count == 0:
            logger.error("‚ùå No records remaining after transformation")
            return None, None
        
        # Write to output path (Parquet format)
        logger.info(f"Writing PostgreSQL-ready data to {output_path}")
        try:
            postgresql_df.write \
                .mode("overwrite") \
                .option("overwriteSchema", "true") \
                .parquet(output_path)
            logger.info("‚úÖ Parquet export completed successfully")
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Failed to write Parquet: {str(e)}")
            return postgresql_df, None
        
        # Create a PostgreSQL-compatible CSV for import
        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
        csv_output_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/postgresql_import_{timestamp}"
        
        # Create PostgreSQL-compatible CSV
        logger.info(f"Creating PostgreSQL-compatible CSV export at {csv_output_path}")
        try:
            csv_path = create_postgresql_compatible_csv(postgresql_df, csv_output_path)
            logger.info("‚úÖ CSV export initiated")
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå CSV export failed: {str(e)}")
            return postgresql_df, None
        
        # Verify the CSV export
        try:
            if mssparkutils.fs.exists(csv_output_path):
                logger.info(f"‚úÖ CSV directory created successfully: {csv_output_path}")
                
                # Find the actual CSV file within the directory
                files = mssparkutils.fs.ls(csv_output_path)
                csv_file_path = None
                
                for file in files:
                    if file.name.endswith('.csv') and 'part-' in file.name:
                        csv_file_path = file.path
                        break
                
                if csv_file_path:
                    logger.info(f"‚úÖ CSV file found: {csv_file_path}")
                    logger.info(f"üìä Final export statistics:")
                    logger.info(f"   - Initial records: {initial_count}")
                    logger.info(f"   - After creation_date filtering: {filtered_count}")
                    logger.info(f"   - Final exported records: {final_count}")
                    logger.info(f"   - Records cleaned/removed: {filtered_count - final_count}")
                    logger.info(f"   - Data loss percentage: {((filtered_count - final_count) / filtered_count * 100):.2f}%")
                else:
                    logger.warning("‚ö†Ô∏è CSV directory created but no CSV file found inside")
                    # List all files for debugging
                    logger.info("Files in CSV directory:")
                    for file in files:
                        logger.info(f"   - {file.name}")
                    csv_file_path = csv_output_path  # Return directory path as fallback
            else:
                logger.error("‚ùå CSV export failed - output directory not created")
                csv_file_path = None
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Error verifying CSV export: {str(e)}")
            csv_file_path = None
        
        logger.info("üéâ PostgreSQL export pipeline completed successfully")
        return postgresql_df, csv_file_path
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"‚ùå Error in PostgreSQL export process: {str(e)}")
        import traceback
        logger.error("Full traceback:")
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
        return None, None

def check_data_availability():
    """
    Quick function to check what data is available before running the full export
    """
    try:
        storage_account = "baubaisadfsaprod"
        source_path = f"abfss://dl-juror-eric-voters-temp@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated_delta"
        
        logger.info(f"Checking data availability in {source_path}")
        
        # Check if path exists
        if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(source_path):
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Source path does not exist: {source_path}")
            return False
        
        source_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(source_path)
        
        total_count = source_df.count()
        logger.info(f"‚úÖ Total records in Delta table: {total_count}")
        
        if total_count == 0:
            logger.warning("‚ö†Ô∏è Delta table exists but contains no records")
            return False
        
        # Check creation_dates
        logger.info("üìÖ Available creation_dates:")
        creation_dates = source_df.select("creation_date").distinct().orderBy("creation_date").collect()
        
        for date_row in creation_dates:
            count_for_date = source_df.filter(col("creation_date") == lit(date_row.creation_date)).count()
            logger.info(f"   - {date_row.creation_date}: {count_for_date:,} records")
        
        # Check sample data structure
        logger.info("üìã Sample data columns:")
        for col_name in source_df.columns[:10]:  # Show first 10 columns
            logger.info(f"   - {col_name}")
        
        if len(source_df.columns) > 10:
            logger.info(f"   ... and {len(source_df.columns) - 10} more columns")
            
        return True
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"‚ùå Error checking data: {str(e)}")
        import traceback
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
        return False

# Execute the export with enhanced functionality
if __name__ == "__main__":
    logger.info("üöÄ Starting Enhanced PostgreSQL Export Pipeline")
    
    # First check data availability
    logger.info("Step 1: Checking data availability...")
    if check_data_availability():
        logger.info("‚úÖ Data availability check passed")
        
        # Run the export
        logger.info("Step 2: Running PostgreSQL export...")
        result_df, csv_path = export_voters_to_postgresql_schema()
        
        if result_df is not None and csv_path is not None:
            logger.info("üéâ Enhanced PostgreSQL export pipeline completed successfully")
            logger.info(f"üìÅ CSV export path: {csv_path}")
            logger.info(f"üìä Total records exported: {result_df.count():,}")
            
            # Show sample of final data
            logger.info("üìã Sample of exported data:")
            sample_data = result_df.limit(3).collect()
            for i, row in enumerate(sample_data):
                logger.info(f"   Row {i+1}: lname={row.lname}, fname={row.fname}, address={row.address}, address4={row.address4}")
                
        else:
            logger.error("‚ùå Export pipeline failed")
            if result_df is None:
                logger.error("   - DataFrame transformation failed")
            if csv_path is None:
                logger.error("   - CSV export failed")
    else:
        logger.error("‚ùå Data availability check failed - cannot proceed with export")
